conclusion: Understanding the behavior of light as it travels from water to air and forms illuminated areas.
Light refracts according to Snell's Law when traveling from a denser to a rarer medium.
Snell's Law: n1 * sin(theta1) = n2 * sin(theta2).
Light travels from water (n1, n2) to air (n_air = 1).
Critical angle for total internal reflection occurs when refraction angle is 90 degrees.
For light B, critical angle theta_cB: sin(theta_cB) = 1/n2.
Small circular area is illuminated by both light A and B.
Large circular area is only illuminated by light B.
Light A undergoes total internal reflection at the boundary of the small circular area.
At the boundary of the small circular area, light B is at the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Sine value of the refraction angle of light B at the boundary is 1/n2.
Final answer: sine value of the refraction angle of light B is 1/n2.
